column2: disputes,  it  is  vital  that  courts  and  tribunals  keep  in  mind  the  possibility  of  an
employer who merely dislikes a particular employee or does not any longer require
his services, making use of the ground ‘loss of confidence’ as a means of providing
a  justification  for  the  arbitrary  or  unjustifiable  dismissal  of  an  employee.  This
Appeal,  appears  to  be  on  that  point.  Termination  of  employment  of  an
employee on loss of confidence must be  supported by cogent evidence. As
held in the case of Peiris v Celltel Lanka Limited [SC Appeal 30/2009, SC Minutes
of 11.03.2011], “it should not be a disguise to cover up the employer’s inability to
establish charges in a disciplinary inquiry, but must be actually based on a bona
organization to continue to keep him in service…” [Emphasis added].
